0.00.text: "I have developed a technique to help me deal with annoying idiots."

7.00.text: Lee, do you want to kick this one off?

13.00.text: Well, first of all, who do you find is an annoying idiot?

16.00.text: I mean, what type of people?

20.00.text: You know, the General Public wind me up from time to time.

24.00.text: OK. And I really want to tell them how I feel,

27.00.text: and instead of doing that I scat.

36.00.text: Can I ask at this point...

38.00.text: what is a scat? Do you know what a scat is?

41.00.text: Like jazz....jazz scatting, isn't it? It's like, the old jazz scat,

45.00.text: yeah. It's your basic jazz rap.

46.00.text: So, you must make random noises?

48.00.text: Let's... Can we have a scenario now, right?

50.00.text: Is it a...? That's a very negative view of music, Lee.

60.00.text: Yeah. ..what would annoy you if I was a doctor?

62.00.text: If you kept me waiting for too long and then,

64.00.text: say you come into the reception room

65.00.text: and I thought I was next... Right. ..and I went to get up

68.00.text: and then you picked somebody else, for example. OK, well, imagine that

71.00.text: scenario, OK? OK. So, I walk in, you think I'm going to see you,

74.00.text: and I go, "Mr Brydon, we've got the results of your test."

77.00.text: And I'd go, "Oh for the bampity-bampity, le-bampity, bam...

99.00.text: Do you promise me that you always do it out loud?

102.00.text: You don't just do it in your mind?

104.00.text: I always vocalise it. Otherwise, if I don't let it out,

108.00.text: it might turn into a haemorrhoid.

112.00.text: I must say, that explains a lot.

115.00.text: Well, imagine now, imagine I've made you angry, OK?

118.00.text: Perhaps he's given you an STD.

124.00.text: At least have the decency to say I've given it to him via his wife.

132.00.text: Watch him now. Go on, jazz scat him, quick!

159.00.text: When was the last time you had to employ it, Michael?

165.00.text: Yeah? What happened? The classic thing of the, you know,

169.00.text: the tourist walking out of the department store and stopping.

172.00.text: And I wasn't paying attention and I walked up and they were there in

175.00.text: front of me, and I went "Why did you fuh-foh-feh-foh-fah-ba-bee-dee..."

178.00.text: And walked round them and carried on walking.

180.00.text: What are you thinking, Diane? Does this have the ring of truth for you?

183.00.text: Yeah, it does. He seems really convincing.

186.00.text: Don't you think? Mmmm, I don't know.

187.00.text: Why are you getting so upset in the first place?

190.00.text: Why don't you just be like me and really just laid-back?

192.00.text: Just get outside the department store and just stop and enjoy life.

196.00.text: When I've ever left a department store, I'm always sprinting.

206.00.text: It's very bizarre behaviour. If you encountered it, you know?

209.00.text: You can't spend your life doing that.

211.00.text: So, what are you going to say?

213.00.text: So we're going to say... You're saying true,

215.00.text: you're going to say lie. Yeah. I'm going to have to go lie.

217.00.text: It can't be true. You're saying it's a lie.

219.00.text: OK, Michael Smiley, was it the truth or was it a lie?

228.00.text: Yes, it's true - Michael does have a technique to deal with annoying idiots and it is scatting.
